meanings.definition: A cord or wire on which clean laundry is hung to dry.
meanings.sent1: The clotheslines in the backyard were filled with colorful clothes fluttering in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: She hung her freshly washed shirts on the clotheslines to dry in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the clotheslines as a tightrope to cross the yard.
meanings.sent4: The clotheslines stretched across the yard like spiderwebs, holding up the laundry.
meanings.sent5: The clotheslines sagged under the weight of the wet clothes, swaying gently in the wind.

meanings.definition: To hang laundry on a clothesline to dry.
meanings.sent1: I always clothesline my jeans on the backyard clothesline to save energy.
meanings.sent2: She clotheslines her bedsheets every weekend to enjoy the fresh air scent.
meanings.sent3: The kids thought it would be funny to clothesline each other with the clotheslines, but it ended in laughter.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind clotheslined the clothes on the clothesline, making them dance in the air.
meanings.sent5: He carefully clotheslines each piece of clothing, ensuring they have enough space to dry properly.
